title: 108_hr1997
content: The Unborn Victims of Violence Act of 2004, also known as "Laci and Conner's Law," amends Title 18 of the United States Code to include a new chapter, "Protection of Unborn Children," which outlines measures for the protection of unborn children. The Unborn Victims of Violence Act of 2004, also known as "Laci and Conner's Law," establishes a separate offense for causing harm to a child in utero, with punishment equivalent to harming the mother under Federal law. Proof of knowledge or intent regarding the pregnancy is not required for this offense. Knowledge or intent regarding the pregnancy is not required for this offense. If the person intentionally kills or attempts to kill the unborn child, they will be punished as provided under specific sections of the law for intentionally killing a human being. The death penalty cannot be imposed for an offense under this section. The Act lists specific sections of the law for intentional harm to an unborn child, including various criminal offenses.
